intro: Tetragonanthus alatus, commonly known as the winged milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its quadrangular stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. Tetragonanthus alatus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
